alert.note: Alert for Yavapai (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 01 at 4:00PM MST until January 01 at 9:15PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM MST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall combined with snowmelt from higher elevations is expected. * WHERE...A portion of west central Arizona, including the following county, Yavapai. * WHEN...Until 1000 PM MST Sunday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in creeks and normally dry washes is imminent or occurring. Numerous low water crossings will flood through Rimrock and Lake Montezuma. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 351 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain and snowmelt at the higher elevations. A stream gauge on Wet Beaver Creek east of Rimrock has risen 5 feet with a flow of 3000 cubic feet per second. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Rarick Canyon, Russell Wash, Beaver Creek, Walker Creek and Dry Beaver Creek. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Rimrock, Montezuma Well, Lake Montezuma, Montezuma Castle National Monument, V Bar V Visitors Center and Wet Beaver Creek Campground. - Visit www.weather.gov/safety/flood for more information on flood safety.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
